title: Alexander Bell (sportsman)
text:
Alexander (Alec) Patrick Bell (23 February 1915 – 12 April 1956) was an <a href="Argentine%20people">Argentine</a> born English <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er and <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. Bell was a right-handed <a href="Batting%20%28cricket%29">batsman</a> and played <a href="Centre%20%28rugby%20union%29">centre</a> for the <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a> rugby team. He was born at <a href="Rosario%2C%20Santa%20Fe">Rosario</a>, <a href="Santa%20Fe%20Province">Santa Fe</a>.
Bell made three <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class</a> appearances for <a href="Northamptonshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Northamptonshire</a> in the <a href="1934%20County%20Championship">1934 County Championship</a> against <a href="Worcestershire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Worcestershire</a>, <a href="Middlesex%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Middlesex</a> and <a href="Glamorgan%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Glamorgan</a>. In these three matches, he scored a total of just 37 runs at an <a href="batting%20average%20%28cricket%29">average</a> of 6.16, with a high score of 24. He later made thirteen <a href="Minor%20Counties%20Championship">Minor Counties Championship</a> appearances for <a href="Hertfordshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Hertfordshire</a> between 1946 and 1949.
As a rugby player he was a prolific try-scoring centre and captained the <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a> for 3 years from 1943 to 1946.
Bell died from a brain trauma at <a href="Oxford">Oxford</a>, <a href="Oxfordshire">Oxfordshire</a> on 12 April 1956.
